de.polygonal.ds.Heap

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A heap is a special kind of binary tree in which every node is greater than all of its children.
The implementation is based on an arrayed binary tree.
All elements have to implement the Comparable interface.

Constructor

new(?removable : Bool, ?maxSize : Int)
parameters
removable If true, elements can be removed by using the remove() method (slower, set to false if removal is not required).
maxSize The maximum allowed size of the heap. The default value of -1 does not impose a size constraint.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this heap.
Call compact() afterwards to make all elements accessible for the garbage collector.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this heap array.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function. The size of the duplicate is unbound (maxSize()=-1).

compact() : Void

To ensure the best possible performance, removing elements does not shrink the underlying container to the actual number of stored elements - they continue to exist even though they were removed. For that reason, calling compact() is needed to ensure that all removed elements can be garbage collected in the future.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this heap contains x.

dequeue() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The heap is empty (if debug flag is set).
Dequeues x.

enqueue(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The heap is full or x is null (if debug flag is set).
Enqueues x.

front() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The heap is empty (if debug flag is set).
The heap's front item.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this heap is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this heap.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size of the heap. Once the maximum size is reached, enqueueing an element will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Always returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

remove(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError The heap is empty, x does not exist or the heap does not support removing elements (if debug flag is set).
Removes x.

size() : Int

The total number of elements in this heap.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array in a random order. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. If compiled with -debug all elements are printed in the order the dequeue() method would return them.
Example: 
	  class Foo implements de.polygonal.ds.Comparable
	  {
	    public var id:Int;
	    public function new(id:Int)
	    {
	      this.id = id;
	    }
	    public function compare(other:Foo):Int
	    {
	      return other.id - id;
	    }
	    public function toString():String
	    {
	      return Std.string(id);
	    }
	  }
	  ...
	  var h = new de.polygonal.ds.Heap(4);
	  h.enqueue(new Foo(64));
	  h.enqueue(new Foo(13));
	  h.enqueue(new Foo(1));
	  h.enqueue(new Foo(37));
	  trace(h); //output:

	  {Heap, size: 4}
	    |< front
	    0 -> 1
	    1 -> 13
	    2 -> 37
	    3 -> 64
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector in a random order. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
